intro: Elatostema kimhyense, commonly known as the Korean false shamrock, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
